name: unbruised
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
not emotionally hurt after a bad experience: It's a great feeling to emerge unbruised by life's hard knocks. Unbruised by life, he thought that once he decided to have something, he could get it.
(of fruit) not damaged: Select unbruised, slightly soft berries with a deep colour and a pleasant smell. Dessert apples will keep until Christmas if stored unbruised, ideally on cardboard trays.
without bruises (= marks where the skin is darker in colour, often as a result of being hit by something): She placed her hand on the unbruised side of his face.
More examplesFewer examplesShe appears to have started the kind of moral battle from which no one emerges unbruised.Separate the unbruised figs into smaller containers where they won't put so much pressure on the fruit below.The coach decided to keep his front-line players fresh and unbruised for their final game on Saturday.
